_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Chemical and Allied Products Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Hawkins, Inc. was founded in 1938 and is a progressive business that supplies chemicals, delivery systems and expertise to improve the environment.  We create alternative solutions for delivery and assist customers in creating new offerings across many markets.  Our traditional focus has been on the sale, delivery and safe handling of bulk chemicals. Today, Hawkins is becoming more specialized by working with customers with very exacting specifications seeking appropriate and innovative alternatives to meet their needs.



Hawkins is based in Roseville, Minnesota with branches throughout the United States.  The Hawkins Water Treatment Group (HWTG) provides water and waste-water treatment equipment and chemicals to improve the quality of life and operate in concert with the environment.  Hawkins also serves regional customers in the Industrial sector in the fields of energy, electronics, chemical processing, pulp and paper, medical devices and metal finishing.  Food manufacturers, processing plants, and pharmaceutical concerns across the nation benefit from Hawkins' chemical distribution, blending and related expertise.



Hawkins' mission is to exceed our customers' expectations as a high-quality, service-oriented chemical supplier. We adapt quickly to the changing chemical needs of customers with a keen focus on technical expertise, teamwork, safety, profitability, and responsible care of the environment and of our community.

Executive Summary 

Prevention and Emergency Response policies:  Hawkins management and safety committee has set a motto of "Think Safe! Be Safe!" regarding accidents and injuries.  Support for this motto is manifested in several way, including:

1. A corporate Health, Safety and Environmental department staffed with trained professionals.

2. Training programs in chemical safety, safe material handling, accident prevention and emergency response.

3. Prompt investigation of near misses and incidents to identify root causes and implement meas

ures to prevent future occurrences.

4. Adherence to all EPA and OSHA regulations governing our operations.

5. Compliance with DOT requirements regarding shipping of materials.

6. Internal and 3rd party audits of Health, Safety and Environmental procedures at all Hawkins locations.

7. Members in good standing with the Chlorine Institute and the National Association of Chemical Distributors.



Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled:  The Hawkins Water Treatment Group - Muncie Facility is a chemical distribution warehouse that stores and distributes many materials used to protect public health by treating water, wastewater, swimming pools and other uses.  The chemical covered by both Process Safety Management and Risk Management Plan for this facility is chlorine.  An additional chemical covered by Risk Management Plan for this facility is sulfur dioxide (anhydrous).  The covered processes consist of:  container transfer and storage of those containers.  This site does not manufacture, package or use chlorine or sulfur dioxide (anhydrous) on site.

Prevention Program:  Hawkins accident prevention program includes:

1. Procedures and training for handling chemicals during shipping and storage;  

2. Ensure shipper provides DOT approved containers;  

3. Provide employees with equipment to safely move chemicals during storage and transportation;

4. Adhere to OSHA workplace regulations;  

5. Follow Chlorine Institute standards.



 

5-Year Accident History:  There has not been an accident involving chlorine or sulfur dioxide (anhydrous) at this facility.



Emergency Response:  In the event of a chlorine or sulfur dioxide (anhydrous) release, Hawkins Water Treatment Group employees are trained to investigate the situation, if safe to do so, and:

1. Call the local fire department for hazmat assistance.

2. Evacuate to a safe distance.  

Representatives of the Muncie Fire Protection District have toured the facility and are aware of the chemicals

on site.  To help assist the local fire department, Hawkins has a special recovery vessel on site in which a leaking 150 pound or smaller cylinder can be inserted to contain any further release.



Planned Changes:  While Hawkins desires to continually improve safety, there are no specific changes planned other than to continue compliance with industry standards and government regulations and our own commitment to "Think Safe! Be Safe!"
